title: Waverley; Or 'Tis Sixty Years Since - Complete
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: In the family ofScott of Thirlestane (not Thirlestane in the Forest, but the placeof the same name in Roxburghshire) was long preserved a cup of thesame kind, in the form of a jack-boot.

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since - Volume 1
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: In the family ofScott of Thirlestane (not Thirlestane in the Forest, but the placeof the same name in Roxburghshire) was long preserved a cup of thesame kind, in the form of a jack-boot.

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: Sir John Scott of Thirlestane, his maternal ancestor, was the only chief willing to follow James V. in his invasion of England, when the rest of the Scottish nobles, encamped at Fala, obstinately refused to take part in the expedition.

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: Further up are the ruins of Thirlestane Castle, and close by, the modern mansion of Thirlestane, the seat of Lord Napier, the lineal descendant of the old family of the Scotts of Thirlestane, as well as of the still more famous one of the Napiers of Merchiston.

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter

title: Memoirs of the life of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Lockhart, J. G.

title: Reminiscences of Yarrow. Edited and annotated by ... Professor Veitch, LL.D. Illustrated by Tom Scott ... Second edition
author: Russell, James
snippet: Whenintroducing Mr Bennet at Ettrick, he stayed atThirlestane with his cousin, the late Lord Napier.

author: Russell, James
snippet: Two pretended shipwrecked sailorscame to Thirlestane with a long and lugubriousstory.

title: Reminiscences of Yarrow. Edited and annotated by ... Professor Veitch, LL.D. Illustrated by Tom Scott ... Second edition
author: Russell, James
snippet: The roads being slippery, myfather walked across the hills to Thirlestane theday before, to be ready for the ordination.

title: Reminiscences of Yarrow. Edited and annotated by ... Professor Veitch, LL.D. Illustrated by Tom Scott ... Second edition
author: Russell, James
snippet: His noble friend and patron, Lord Napier, occasionally came to the parish; but his house atThirlestane being then very small, he rented Wilton Lodge, near Hawick, to which my father hada standing invitation.

title: Reminiscences of Yarrow. Edited and annotated by ... Professor Veitch, LL.D. Illustrated by Tom Scott ... Second edition
author: Russell, James
snippet: With a letter of introduction from Lord Napier, hecame to Bridgelands; and escorted by Mr GeorgeRodger, his Lordship's country agent, rode upEttrick, and found quarters under the roof of MrCunningham, his lordship's tenant at Thirlestane.

title: Reminiscences of Yarrow. Edited and annotated by ... Professor Veitch, LL.D. Illustrated by Tom Scott ... Second edition
author: Russell, James
snippet: Although it is a digression, I may mention thatat the outbreak of the Crimean War, Sir Charlespaid a brief visit to Thirlestane.
